item.title: Blackstone 将 Hipgnosis 的报价提高了 1 美分
item.description: Blackstone 周一将其对 Hipgnosis Songs Fund 的报价提高了 1 美分，达到每股 1.31 美元，对这家拥有夏奇拉和 Red Hot Chili Peppers 等艺人的音乐版权所有者的估值为 15.8 亿美元。【原文：Blackstone on Monday raised its offer for Hipgnosis Songs Fund by a cent to $1.31 per share, valuing the music rights owner of artists such as Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers at $1.58 billion.】

item.title: 腾讯和腾讯音乐收购泰国 GMM 音乐公司股份，估值达 7 亿美元
item.description: 泰国娱乐平台 GMM Music 周一表示，腾讯和腾讯音乐娱乐将收购该公司 10% 的股份，估值达 7 亿美元。【原文：Thai entertainment platform GMM Music on Monday said Tencent and Tencent Music Entertainment will acquire a 10% stake in the company, valuing it at $700 million.】

item.title: 丰田及其他日本汽车制造商因汽车认证问题受到抨击
item.description: 丰田汽车公司周一表示，在日本交通部的推动下，公司董事长将就其对汽车认证申请进行的调查发表讲话。【原文：Toyota Motor said on Monday its chairman would speak about an investigation it has conducted into its vehicle certification applications after being prompted by Japan's transport ministry.】

item.title: 美国对英国科技公司创始人迈克-林奇的刑事审判即将结束
item.description: 英国科技先驱迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）欺诈案的陪审员预计将于周一在旧金山听取结案陈词，该案与惠普公司 2011 年斥资 110 亿美元收购其软件公司 Autonomy 有关。【原文：Jurors at the trial of British tech pioneer Mike Lynch are expected to hear closing arguments in San Francisco on Monday in the fraud case related to Hewlett-Packard's $11 billion acquisition of his software company Autonomy in 2011.】

item.title: 卡塔尔航空公司正在洽谈空客和波音订单
item.description: 卡塔尔航空公司（Qatar Airways）首席执行官周一表示，该公司正在与飞机制造商空中客车公司（Airbus）和波音公司（Boeing）洽谈大型宽体客机订单。【原文：Qatar Airways is in talks with plane makers Airbus and Boeing for a major wide-body order, its chief executive said on Monday.】

item.title: 全球航空公司上调 2024 年利润展望
item.description: 全球航空公司周一上调了 2024 年的利润预期，并预计随着旅客登机人数创下新高，全行业收入将接近 1 万亿美元。【原文：Global airlines on Monday raised their profit forecast for 2024 and projected industry-wide revenues just shy of $1 trillion as a record number of travellers board flights.】

item.title: 聚焦：继中国之后，Zara 将现场购物实验扩展到欧洲和美国
item.description: 今年，Zara 将把购物直播扩展到英国、欧洲和美国，对这种在中国已经大受欢迎但西方购物者不太熟悉的形式进行测试。【原文：Zara will expand its live shopping broadcasts to the UK, Europe and the United States this year, testing a format that is already wildly popular in China but one with which Western shoppers are less familiar.】

item.title: 审判之后，大选在即，投资者权衡特朗普 2.0 因素
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上周成为首位被判重罪的前总统，但华尔街认为他仍有很大机会在 11 月的大选中获胜，并正在研究这位共和党候选人的第二个任期会对市场产生怎样的影响。【原文：Donald Trump last week became the first former president convicted of a felony, but Wall Street believes he still has a solid chance of winning the November election and is gaming out how a second term for the Republican candidate could impact markets.】

item.title: Arm 预计到 2025 年底将有 1,000 亿台 Arm 设备为人工智能做好准备
item.description: 英国芯片设计公司Arm Holdings首席执行官雷内-哈斯（Rene Haas）周一在台北举行的Computex论坛上表示，预计到明年年底，全球将有1000亿台Arm设备为人工智能做好准备。【原文：British chip designer Arm Holdings expects 100 billion Arm devices worldwide will be ready for artificial intelligence by the end of next year, the company's chief executive, Rene Haas, said on Monday at the Computex forum in Taipei.】

item.title: 早间竞价：工厂嗡嗡作响，市场情绪高涨
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，Blackstone 将提高 Hipgnosis 的出价，作为修订后出价的一部分
item.description: 据《金融时报》周一报道，作为修订后出价的一部分，Blackstone 将把对 Hipgnosis Songs Fund 的出价从 1.30 美元提高 1 美分至 1.31 美元。【原文：Blackstone will sweeten its offer for Hipgnosis Songs Fund by a cent to $1.31 from $1.30 as part of a revised bid, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 全球需求强劲，5 月份亚洲工厂活动扩大
item.description: 周一的民间调查显示，由于制造商受益于全球需求的扩大，亚洲工厂活动在5月份有所扩大，这增加了该地区经济持续复苏的希望，而中国正显示出经济反弹的早期迹象。【原文：Asian factory activity expanded in May as manufacturers benefited from broadening global demand, private surveys showed on Monday, adding to hopes for sustained economic recovery in the region where China is showing early signs of rebound.】

item.title: AMD 推出新款人工智能芯片，与领头羊英伟达一较高下
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）周一发布了其最新的人工智能处理器，并详细介绍了其未来两年开发人工智能芯片的计划，以挑战行业领导者英伟达（Nvidia）。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices unveiled its latest artificial intelligence processors on Monday and detailed its plan to develop AI chips over the next two years in a bid to challenge industry leader Nvidia .】

item.title: 财新PMI显示中国工厂活动增速创两年新高
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，中国制造业活动在 5 月份以约两年来最快的速度增长，生产和新订单强劲，表明在扶持性产业政策的支持下，中国制造业依然保持强劲。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in May grew at the fastest pace in about two years with strong production and new orders, a private sector survey showed on Monday, indicating the sector remains robust amid supportive industrial policies.】

item.title: 美国通胀报告公布后，货币走势谨慎，欧洲央行成为关注焦点
item.description: 本周货币市场谨慎开局，周一美元小幅走低，因为上周数据显示美国4月份通胀趋于稳定，为美联储在今年晚些时候降息敞开了大门。【原文：The currency market started the week cautiously, with the dollar slightly lower on Monday after data last week showed U.S inflation had stabilised in April, keeping the door open for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates later in the year.】

item.title: 澳大利亚提高最低工资标准，应对家庭生活成本增加问题
item.description: 澳大利亚独立的工资制定机构周一将全国最低工资上调了 3.75%，基本与通胀保持一致，以应对家庭生活成本的飙升。【原文：Australia's independent wage-setting body on Monday raised the national minimum wage by 3.75%, largely in line with inflation, as families tackle soaring living costs.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》执行主编莎莉-布兹比卸任
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》执行主编莎莉-布兹比（Sally Buzbee）是首位领导该报新闻编辑部的女性，她已于周日卸任。【原文：The executive editor of the Washington Post, Sally Buzbee, the first woman to lead the newspaper's newsroom, has stepped down from her role, the publication said on Sunday.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因本周有望进一步降息而反弹
item.description: 亚洲股市周一上涨，原因是投资者期待欧洲（很可能还有加拿大）降息，将其作为全球宽松政策的下一步，尽管持续的通胀有可能使这一进程旷日持久。【原文：Asian share markets rose on Monday as investors looked forward to a rate cut in Europe, and quite possibly Canada, as the next step in global policy easing, though sticky inflation threatens to make the process a drawn out affair.】

item.title: 韩国工厂活动以两年来最快速度扩张
item.description: 一项私营部门调查周一显示，由于全球需求扩大，产出和订单增长强劲，韩国 5 月份工厂活动以两年来最快的速度扩张。【原文：South Korea's factory activity expanded in May at the fastest pace in two years on stronger growth in output and orders thanks to broadening global demand, a private-sector survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 尽管欧佩克+延长减产，油价仍出现下滑
item.description: 该集团同意将日减产 366 万桶的期限延长一年，直至 2025 年底。该集团还将把日减产 220 万桶的期限延长三个月，直至 9 月底。【原文：The group agreed to extend cuts of 3.66 million barrels per day by a year until the end of 2025. It will also prolong the cuts of 2.2 million barrels per day by three months until the end of September.】

item.title: 日本制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示，日本 5 月工厂活动一年来首次出现扩张
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，日本 5 月份的工厂活动出现一年来的首次扩张，但总体增长温和，需求仍然低迷，日元疲软提高了一些生产商的进口商品成本。【原文：Japan's factory activity expanded for the first time in a year in May, a private-sector survey showed on Monday, but overall growth was modest and demand was still subdued while a weak yen raised the cost of imported items for some producers.】

item.title: 即使市场正在复苏，繁文缛节仍阻塞了中国的境外 IPO 渠道
item.description: 银行家、中国公司高管及其投资者表示，他们预计今年的海外 IPO 荒将持续下去，这将影响企业在经济放缓的情况下筹集资金的能力。【原文：Bankers, China company executives and their investors said they expect the offshore IPO drought to continue this year, weighing on firms' ability to raise capital in a slowing economy.】

item.title: 早间新闻PMI 盛宴拉开新月序幕，聚焦中国
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，修订后的 Skydance 要约将使派拉蒙股东以每股 15 美元的价格套现
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日援引知情人士的话报道，Skydance Media 上周修改了对派拉蒙全球公司的收购要约，以每股 15 美元的价格购买一定数量的无投票权派拉蒙股票。【原文：Skydance Media last week revised its offer for Paramount Global to buy up to a certain number of non-voting Paramount shares at $15 each, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据天空新闻报道，在线时尚巨头 Shein 将提交招股说明书，计划在伦敦发行 500 亿英镑股票
item.description: 据天空新闻周日援引消息人士的话报道，在线时尚巨头 Shein 正准备向英国金融行为监管局递交招股说明书，以便在可能的伦敦上市前获得批准，其估值可能达到约 500 亿英镑（637.0 亿美元）。【原文：Online fashion giant Shein is preparing to file a prospectus with UK's Financial Conduct Authority for approval ahead of its potential London float which could value it at about 50 billion pounds ($63.70 billion), Sky News reported on Sunday, citing sources.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，卡塔尔航空公司接近获得波音和空客宽体客机大订单
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，卡塔尔航空公司（Qatar Airways PJSC）即将就波音和空客的大型宽体客机订单作出决定。【原文：Qatar Airways PJSC is nearing a decision on a major widebody order split between Boeing and Airbus , Bloomberg News reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 阿联酋航空老板称波音需要强有力的首席执行官来结束危机
item.description: 迪拜阿联酋航空公司负责人敦促波音公司挑选一位工程和商业界的重量级人物来领导对这家美国航空巨头的深入改革，并表示结束这家飞机制造商最近的信任危机的任务 "必须完成"。【原文：The head of Dubai airline Emirates urged Boeing to pick an engineering and business heavyweight to lead a deep overhaul of the U.S. aerospace giant and said the task of ending the planemaker's recent confidence crisis "must get done".】

item.title: 空中客车公司首席执行官：欧洲需要加大对国防生产的投资
item.description: 空中客车公司首席执行官对一家德国报纸说，欧洲必须在国防项目上更加紧密地合作，并增加对生产能力的投资。【原文：Europe must work more closely on defence projects and raise investment in production capacity, the chief executive of Airbus told a German newspaper.】

item.title: 土耳其 Pegasus 公司即将开始订购新飞机，2029 年后交付
item.description: 土耳其飞马航空公司（Pegasus Airlines）首席执行官周日告诉路透社，该公司将在未来几个月内开始下一份飞机订单的工作，因为它希望在下一个十年继续保持快速增长。【原文：Turkey's Pegasus Airlines will in the coming months begin work on its next plane order as it looks to continue its fast-paced growth into the next decade, the budget carrier's CEO told Reuters on Sunday.】

item.title: 新日铁的森喜朗本周返回美国，就收购美国钢铁公司进行谈判
item.description: 新日铁副董事长计划本周返回美国，就收购美国钢铁公司的提议进行更多会谈，并将研究在必要时出售部分资产，以促成交易。【原文：Nippon Steel's vice chairman plans to return to the United States this week for more talks over the proposed acquisition of U.S. Steel and would study selling some assets if necessary for the deal to go through.】
